Višje plače za del zaposlenih v javnem sektorju
01 Nov 2019, 10:44 by STA

Z novembrom se bodo delu zaposlenih v javnem sektorju plače znova nekoliko izboljšale. Gre za drugi del povišanja, o katerem so se vlada in sindikati javnega sektorja dogovorili s stavkovnimi sporazumi in dogovorom o plačah decembra lani. Finančni učinki tokratnega povišanja so na mesečni ravni ocenjeni na 7,6 milijona evrov.



Foto: pixabay.com

LJUBLJANA > Z omenjenimi sporazumi izpred leta dni so z januarjem 2019 en plačni razred, ki za posameznika pomeni približno štiriodstoten dvig plače, pridobili vsi zaposleni v javnem sektorju z izjemo zdravnikov, funkcionarjev in direktorjev.
S tokratnim, novembrskim povišanjem bo še en plačni razred pridobila večina zaposlenih na delovnih mestih nad 26. plačnim razredom, pa tudi del slabše umeščenih na plačni lestvici, ki v letu 2017 v okviru odprave plačnih anomalij niso bili deležni nikakršnega izboljšanja. Po ocenah ministrstva za javno upravo bo ta dvig proračun obremenil za 7,6 milijona evrov mesečno. Natančnejši podatek bo na voljo šele februarja na podlagi poročanja proračunskih uporabnikov o plačah za november.
Zaposleni na delovnih mestih, za katera je pogoj znanstveni magisterij, doktorat ali specializacija, pa s septembrom prihodnje leto lahko računajo še na en plačni razred povišanja.
Po prvem povišanju plač z januarjem se je plačna masa povečala za 3,3 odstotka. Vsaj tako bi lahko sklepali po podatkih s portala plač v javnem sektorju, po katerih je masa za plače v decembru lani znašala 335.273.887 evrov, v januarja letos pa 346.316.537 evrov. Na ministrstvu za javno upravo pri tem opozarjajo, da na povečanje sredstev za plače lahko vplivajo tudi drugi razlogi, kot so povišanje števila zaposlenih, premestitve, spremembe sistemizacij delovnih mest in napredovanja.
V javnem sektorju je po podatkih sistema ISPAP za julij skupaj 174.875 zaposlenih, javnih uslužbencev pa je 173.383. Po podatkih, izračunani na podlagi opravljenih ur, ki se tudi navajajo pri spremljanju obsega javnega sektorja, pa je javnih uslužbencev 170.473.

Higher wages for a portion of public sector employees
01 Nov 2019, 10:44 by STA

As of November, salaries in the public sector will improve slightly again. This is the second part of a raise agreed by the government and public sector unions with strike agreements and a wage agreement last December. The financial impact of this increase is estimated at EUR 7.6 million on a monthly basis.



Photo credit: pixabay.com

LJUBLJANA> With the aforementioned agreements, a year ago, as of January 2019, all public sector employees, with the exception of doctors, functionaries and directors, gained one salary bracket, which amounts to about four per cent pay raise for an individual.
With this November's increase, the majority of employees in jobs above the 26th pay grade will gain another pay grade, as well as some of the less well placed on the pay scale who did not receive any improvement in 2017 as part of the elimination of pay anomalies. According to estimates from the Ministry of Public Administration, this increase will burden the budget by € 7.6 million a month. More detailed information will only be available in February based on budget users' November payroll reports.
Employees in jobs requiring a master's degree, doctorate or specialization may count for another pay grade in September next year.
After the first pay raise in January, the wage bill rose 3.3 percent. At least, this could be deduced from the public sector wage portal, according to which the wage bill amounted to EUR 335,273,887 in December last year and EUR 346,316,537 in January this year. The Ministry of Public Administration also points out that other reasons such as an increase in staff numbers, relocations, changes in job systemisation and promotion can also affect the increase in wage bill.
According to the ISPAP system, there are 174,875 employees in the public sector in July and 173,383 in civil servants. According to the data calculated on the basis of hours worked, which are also reported in the monitoring of the size of the public sector, there are 170,473 civil servants.
